objects.moduledoc:
MastaniServer keeps the contexts that define your domain
and business logic.

Contexts are also responsible for managing your data, regardless
if it comes from the database, an external API or others.

this module defined basic method to handle [CMS] content [CURD] ..
[CMS]: post, job, ...
[CURD]: create, update, delete ...
this module defined the matches and handy guard ...

This module defines the setup for tests requiring
access to the application's data layer.

You may define functions here to be used as helpers in
your tests.

Finally, if the test case interacts with the database,
it cannot be async. For this reason, every test runs
inside a transaction which is reset at the beginning
of the test unless the test case is marked as async.

The entrypoint for defining your web interface, such
as controllers, views, channels and so on.

This can be used in your application as:

    use MastaniServerWeb, :controller
    use MastaniServerWeb, :view

The definitions below will be executed for every view,
controller, etc, so keep them short and clean, focused
on imports, uses and aliases.

Do NOT define functions inside the quoted expressions
below. Instead, define any helper function in modules
and import those modules here.

This module defines the test case to be used by
channel tests.

Such tests rely on `Phoenix.ChannelTest` and also
import other functionality to make it easier
to build common datastructures and query the data layer.

Finally, if the test case interacts with the database,
it cannot be async. For this reason, every test runs
inside a transaction which is reset at the beginning
of the test unless the test case is marked as async.

This module defines the test case to be used by
tests that require setting up a connection.

Such tests rely on `Phoenix.ConnTest` and also
import other functionality to make it easier
to build common datastructures and query the data layer.

Finally, if the test case interacts with the database,
it cannot be async. For this reason, every test runs
inside a transaction which is reset at the beginning
of the test unless the test case is marked as async.

A module providing Internationalization with a gettext-based API.

By using [Gettext](https://hexdocs.pm/gettext),
your module gains a set of macros for translations, for example:

    import MastaniServerWeb.Gettext

    # Simple translation
    gettext "Here is the string to translate"

    # Plural translation
    ngettext "Here is the string to translate",
             "Here are the strings to translate",
             3

    # Domain-based translation
    dgettext "errors", "Here is the error message to translate"

See the [Gettext Docs](https://hexdocs.pm/gettext) for detailed usage.
Module with named helpers generated from MastaniServerWeb.Router.

objects.name: change_user
objects.doc:
Returns an `%Ecto.Changeset{}` for tracking user changes.

## Examples

    iex> change_user(user)
    %Ecto.Changeset{source: %User{}}

objects.name: errors_on
objects.doc:
A helper that transform changeset errors to a map of messages.

    assert {:error, changeset} = Accounts.create_user(%{password: "short"})
    assert "password is too short" in errors_on(changeset).password
    assert %{password: ["password is too short"]} = errors_on(changeset)

objects.name: db_insert
objects.doc:
# not use changeset because in test we may insert some attrs which not in schema
# like: views, insert/update ... to test filter-sort,when ...

objects.name: init
objects.doc:
Dynamically loads the repository url from the
DATABASE_URL environment variable.

objects.name: query
objects.doc:
A convenience function for SQL-based repositories that executes the given query.

See `Ecto.Adapters.SQL.query/3` for more information.

objects.name: query!
objects.doc:
A convenience function for SQL-based repositories that executes the given query.

See `Ecto.Adapters.SQL.query/3` for more information.

objects.name: to_sql
objects.doc:
A convenience function for SQL-based repositories that translates the given query to SQL.

See `Ecto.Adapters.SQL.query/3` for more information.

objects.name: config
objects.doc: Fetches the configuration for this module

objects.name: config
objects.doc:
Returns a resolved value of the configuration found at a key

See `Guardian.Config.resolve_value`

objects.name: decode_and_verify
objects.doc:
Decodes and verifies a token using the configuration on the implementation
module.

See `Guardian.decode_and_verify`

objects.name: default_token_type
objects.doc: The default type of token for this module

objects.name: encode_and_sign
objects.doc:
Encodes the claims.
See `Guardian.encode_and_sign` for more information

objects.name: exchange
objects.doc:
Exchanges a token of one type for another.

See `Guardian.exchange` for more information

objects.name: peek
objects.doc:
Provides the content of the token but without verification
of either the claims or the signature

Claims will be present at the `:claims` key.

See `Guardian.peek` for more information

objects.name: refresh
objects.doc:
Refresh a token.

See `Guardian.refresh` for more information

objects.name: resource_from_token
objects.doc:
Fetch the resource and claims directly from a token

See `Guardian.resource_from_token` for more information

objects.name: revoke
objects.doc:
Revoke a token.

See `Guardian.revoke` for more information

objects.name: done
objects.doc: handle General {:ok, ..} or {:error, ..} return

objects.name: delete
objects.doc:
NOTICE: this should be use together with Authorize/OwnerCheck etc Middleware
DO NOT use it directly

objects.name: find
objects.doc: wrap Repo.get with result/errer format handle

objects.name: paginater
objects.doc: a wrap for paginate request

objects.name: read
objects.doc:
Require queryable has a views fields to count the views of the queryable Modal
if queryable NOT contains views fields consider use read_quiet/2

objects.name: read_all
objects.doc: return  Data required by filter

objects.name: update
objects.doc:
NOTICE: this should be use together with Authorize/OwnerCheck etc Middleware
DO NOT use it directly

objects.name: reactions_hanlder
objects.doc:
handle [3] situation:

1. basic query with filter
2. reaction_user's count
3. is viewer reacted?

bewteen [PART] and [REACT]
[PART]: cms part, include: Post, Job, Meetup ...
[REACT]; favorites, stars, watchs ...

objects.name: __using__
objects.doc: When used, dispatch to the appropriate controller/view/etc.

objects.name: build_context
objects.doc:
Return the current user context based on the authorization header.

Important: Note that at the current time this is just a stub, always
returning the first user (marked as an admin), provided any
authorization header is sent.

objects.name: __sockets__
objects.doc: Returns all sockets configured in this endpoint.

objects.name: config
objects.doc:
Returns the endpoint configuration for `key`

Returns `default` if the key does not exist.

objects.name: config_change
objects.doc: Reloads the configuration given the application environment changes.

objects.name: host
objects.doc: Returns the host for the given endpoint.

objects.name: init
objects.doc:
Callback invoked for dynamically configuring the endpoint.

It receives the endpoint configuration and checks if
configuration should be loaded from the system environment.

objects.name: instrument
objects.doc:
Instruments the given function.

`event` is the event identifier (usually an atom) that specifies which
instrumenting function to call in the instrumenter modules. `runtime` is
metadata to be associated with the event at runtime (e.g., the query being
issued if the event to instrument is a DB query).

## Examples

    instrument :render_view, %{view: "index.html"}, fn ->
      render conn, "index.html"
    end

objects.name: path
objects.doc: Generates the path information when routing to this endpoint.

objects.name: script_name
objects.doc: Generates the script name.

objects.name: start_link
objects.doc: Starts the endpoint supervision tree.

objects.name: static_path
objects.doc: Generates a route to a static file in `priv/static`.

objects.name: static_url
objects.doc:
Generates the static URL without any path information.

It uses the configuration under `:static_url` to generate
such. It falls back to `:url` if `:static_url` is not set.

objects.name: struct_url
objects.doc:
Generates the endpoint base URL but as a `URI` struct.

It uses the configuration under `:url` to generate such.
Useful for manipulating the URL data and passing it to
URL helpers.

objects.name: url
objects.doc:
Generates the endpoint base URL without any path information.

It uses the configuration under `:url` to generate such.

objects.name: call
objects.doc: Callback invoked by Plug on every request.

objects.name: init
objects.doc:
Callback required by Plug that initializes the router
for serving web requests.

objects.name: path
objects.doc: Generates the path information including any necessary prefix.

objects.name: static_path
objects.doc: Generates path to a static asset given its file path.

objects.name: static_url
objects.doc: Generates url to a static asset given its file path.

objects.name: url
objects.doc: Generates the connection/endpoint base URL without any path information.

objects.name: __absinthe_types__
objects.doc: only used for reaction result, like: favorite/star/watch ...
